data.title: Quick, close the fence!
data.statement:
Oh no! One piece of the fence is missing, and your {{C}}ow might escape! 

Given a pasture of length [[l]] and width [[w]], with a cow ({{C}}), grassland ({{.}}) and pieces of fence ({{#}}), output the index of the row and column ([[rowi]], [[coli]], 0-indexed) where the piece of fence is missing. Together with the missing piece, <<the fence should form the borders of a rectangle>> with your {{C}}ow somewhere inside that rectangle.
data.constraints:
3 <= [[l]], [[w]] <= 20
Only one piece is missing
Missing piece is never a corner of the rectangular fence
data.stubGenerator:
read l:int
read w:int
loop l read row:string(20)
write rowi coli
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: integer [[l]], length of the pasture
<<Line 2>>: integer [[w]], width of the pasture
<<Next [[l]] lines>>: string [[row]] of size [[w]]. All [[row]]s together form the pasture.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1>>: two space-separated integers [[rowi]] [[coli]], denoting the row and column (0-indexed) where the fence is missing.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Oh no! One piece of the fence is missing, and your Cow might escape!

Given a pasture of length l and width w, with a cow (C), grassland (.) and pieces of fence (#), output the index of the row and column (rowi, coli, 0-indexed) where the piece of fence is missing. Together with the missing piece, the fence should form the borders of a rectangle with your Cow somewhere inside that rectangle.
Input
Line 1: integer l, length of the pasture
Line 2: integer w, width of the pasture
Next l lines: string row of size w. All rows together form the pasture.
Output
Line 1: two space-separated integers rowi coli, denoting the row and column (0-indexed) where the fence is missing.
Constraints
3 <= l, w <= 20
Only one piece is missing
Missing piece is never a corner of the rectangular fence
Example
Input
3
3
###
#C.
###
Output
1 2
